title: Compiler error when using const generics

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When using a trait function that uses an associated generic constant, the compiler requests a bound to the function using ```rust where [(); G::SIZE]: , ``` If we use that, the code compiles fine. The way I reached to this error is by, instead, using the following bound: ``` where [(); G::SIZE]: Sized, ``` This case works well if the "deepness" of calls of such functions is one. However, if we have such a bounded function, that calls another bounded function as such, we get the compiler error. Playground [example](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c1c2d79380822e94006ce115180ed1d8). ### Code Here is the WORKING example: ```Rust #![allow(incomplete_features)] #![feature(generic_const_exprs)] pub trait Foo { const SIZE: usize; fn to_bytes(&self) -> [u8; Self::SIZE]; } pub fn bar(a: &G) -> u8 where [(); G::SIZE]: , { deeper_bar(a) } fn deeper_bar(a: &G) -> u8 where [(); G::SIZE]: Sized, { a.to_bytes()[0] } ``` And here is the NON-WORKING example ```rust #![allow(incomplete_features)] #![feature(generic_const_exprs)] pub trait Foo { const SIZE: usize; fn to_bytes(&self) -> [u8; Self::SIZE]; } pub fn bar(a: &G) -> u8 where [(); G::SIZE]: Sized, { deeper_bar(a) } fn deeper_bar(a: &G) -> u8 where [(); G::SIZE]: Sized, { a.to_bytes()[0] } ``` Note that in the NON-WORKING version, we bound `bar` with ``` where [(); G::SIZE]: Sized, ``` instead of ```rust where [(); G::SIZE]: , ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0-nightly (5ecc8ad84 2021-09-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: 5ecc8ad8462574354a55162a0c16b10eb95e3e70 commit-date: 2021-09-19 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.57.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` warning: Error finalizing incremental compilation session directory `error_handling/target/debug/incremental/compiler_error-351fbe10uw0cg/s-g2kp181621-1e2ohwr-working`: No such file or directory (os error 2) error: internal compiler error: Encountered error `Unimplemented` selecting `Binder(<^0 as Foo>, [Ty(Anon)])` during codegen | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/codegen.rs:68:32 error: internal compiler error: ty::ConstKind::Error constructed but no error reported. | = note: delayed at /rustc/5ecc8ad8462574354a55162a0c16b10eb95e3e70/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/consts.rs:183:43 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1165:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0-nightly (5ecc8ad84 2021-09-19) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack warning: `compiler_error` (lib) generated 1 warning error: could not compile `compiler_error`; 1 warning emitted ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic_display 3: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::flush_delayed 4: ::drop 5: core::ptr::drop_in_place 6: as core::ops::drop::Drop>::drop 7: core::ptr::drop_in_place 8: rustc_span::with_source_map 9: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set ```
